title: Thread blocked - "thread":"vertx-blocked-thread-checker","class":"BlockedThreadChecker"

labels.name: P4
labels.description: Low (ex: Node doesn't start up when the configuration file has unexpected "end-of-line" character)

labels.name: TeamRevenant
labels.description: GH issues worked on by Revenant Team

body: Hey @rinor are you able to provide more information on the network setup, genesis file used, nodes in the network etc?

- genesis - https://github.com/dcSpark/milkomeda-evm-passive/blob/main/c1-devnet/config/genesis.json
- config - https://github.com/dcSpark/milkomeda-evm-passive/blob/main/c1-devnet/config/config.toml
- explorer/passive/rpc node (the node in question) - `cc221c7ca2670b0e39eeaeae645b813e517f31c4c4c1d28c496b80534277d372959d2af4be4cb169dce0e018c025dfb39428b8ffb80cec564d471e1c897ec6a5`
- 6 validators

all connected through `static-nodes-file`

```json
[
  "enode://93ed276b4cecfe0bc4fb2b33f80a0822920ff438853161f3eb2d234e20860f607ffc63f38e2c03455748f1157e39fce778c666778faf58dc50f79fb37dced0e2@a:30303",
  "enode://640a9dca825965f448b03d6030d66259b53bb4ec14769c20ae8e0ce976c1c612b4fa0a33e6f90dd1cd72dd345047684cbe2087b1e92df801b03872c718e326ae@b:30303",
  "enode://1340659f084bfc21c208f0b552b62e6b46eed4f6dc8172595e035956b18be94e53aec9bb9d0b0b849f03ab249d91d83fd5f1a0873b2171b86541fb7dc61a0508@c:30303",
  "enode://8f4570aefa03b8fc5abf513d0b8e2bcaf4ad865dfc36469c92a1c82eb92c9664e18139f83ce738e9b8fb0912ae30d2b3d59e0a44db5624cdf2dcc56dd497bb10@d:30303",
  "enode://2dd01d4bfec677a67fd4658447ed834e9e62eefd086e7327837d58823a98df447d8ad824dfd58d929f3f286c9c4525269ebe037ffcf67202b092936be6971163@e:30303",
  "enode://1959e3ead5ea3f46846605a6e75c75d7e7501301f5203f19e75c283ffd0be0d6095b89027d9e95782dc73c0713509ebbf1868565bb3ae17204412daa3957f57e@f:30303"
]
```
I'm unassingning myself and putting this one in the backlog, thanks for the info @rinor
Are you seeing this blocked thread logs on one node only? Is it stopping blocks from being produced or other function of the node?

> Are you seeing this blocked thread logs on one node only? Is it stopping blocks from being produced or other function of the node?

The node in question is not a block producer node, just a passive one.
The logs are on the same node that the requester (blockscout explorer in this case) is pointed to and the state afaict right now:
- block propagation is fine
- http rpc interface responds ok
- ws rpc interface has issues/timeouts

Will check again to get more details, but also if there is smth specific you want us to check, please let us know and will provide that information.
If it's not affecting node operation, we are deprioritizing this for the time being. Please let us know if it does start affecting node operation.

> If it's not affecting node operation, we are deprioritizing this for the time being. Please let us know if it does start affecting node operation.

the side-effect of this is that all requests http/ws for historical data fail with timeout hence no operations involving those data can be completed making it impossible to use for explorers or any other application that requires such information. While the node may be operational on its own is mostly unusable for any other operation.

It looks like there is some lock/contention on the storage (no proof though). If you have any suspicion and/or hint where/how to check please let us know so we can investigate further. Thank you
We will test with the latest master again since there are a lot of changes from the latest stable release used and will provide feedback with the results.

Hmmm ok so sounds like it is affecting node operation in a way. 
Blockscout is known to be pretty resource hungry, could it be that it is affecting things? Is it possible to separate the ws rpc interface from where blockscout is running?

> Hmmm ok so sounds like it is affecting node operation in a way. Blockscout is known to be pretty resource hungry, could it be that it is affecting things? Is it possible to separate the ws rpc interface from where blockscout is running?

It is and we tried that, same result. Went even further and lowered the concurrency of blockscout and the batch request sizes just to test.

Will check again that separated setup with the latest version and report back.

also https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/issues/3786 could be related (no OOM in our case since we pushed a lot more  resources)
#3786  is related to trace_replayBlockTransactions - are you using that API?
Closing this issue since no activity in the past 30 days. Feel free to reopen if further help is needed 😊

I'm having this same issue. I connect blockscout to my hyperledger besu deployment and the node isn't able to handle it.

Even reduced the number of concurrent requests in the fetcher but no luck. @rinor were you able to find a fix for this?
@nwasiqUC can you try with the latest version of besu 22.7.0 - and if still having an issue, can you file a new issue with your specific environment and setup details?
